did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Location
repository.corpname: Rare Book and Special Collections Division Library of Congress

did.abstract: Preparatory materials for an edition of Shakespeare's King Lear published by Theodore Press with illustrations printed at the Janus Press.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: Organizations
controlaccess.corpname: King Lear Archive (Library of Congress) DLC

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Purchase from Joshua Heller Rare Books, 31 Jan. 1991.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The records of the King Lear Archive are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Rare Book and Special Collections Division reading room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cite as: King Lear Archive, Rare Book and Special Materials Division, Library of Congress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of woodcuts, drawings, correspondence, proofs, book designers' mockups, and woodblocks for an edition of Shakespeare's The Tragedie of King Lear published by Theodore Press in 1986 with illustrations by Claire Van Vliet. The publication is based on the 1623 first folio text of the play, and was produced in a limited edition of 160 copies, each signed by Claire Van Vliet. The woodcuts include several proofs of each illustration, most of which are images of characters in the drama. The collection also includes preliminary pencil drawings for each of the woodcuts, as well as a complete set of the original wood blocks. Correspondence relating to all aspects of the project during 1985 and 1986 is chiefly by Claire Van Vliet, founder of Janus Press, and Michael Alpert, owner of Theodore Press. The collection was assembled and arranged by Claire Van Vliet.

arrangement.head: Organization of the Papers
arrangement.p: Organized in 13 containers: 1-5. Woodcuts; 6. Drawings; 7. Letters; 8. Trial proofs; 9. Dummies; 10. Corrected proofs; 11. Paste-up; 12. Mock-up;13. Wood blocks.

scopecontent.p:
One bound volume with preliminary graphite drawings for
39 woodcuts (41 drawings, including 3 double-page
spreads)

did.unittitle:
Xeroxed copy of Nonesuch edition of King Lear, with
annotations in pencil and ink
Xeroxed copy of Norton facsimile of First Folio edition of King Lear with annotations in pencil

2 sheets of paper folded into 72 rectangles with text
and illustrations indicated

Two reduced xeroxed paste-ups with preliminary pencil
sketches for illustrations, in paper chemises, one with 12 numbered signatures; the second with 12 numbered and 3 unnumbered signatures

Miniature flat mock-up of binding (birch board and
pigskin) (1)

Two full-size samples of birch binding boards, one
decorated and one plain (2)

Notes from Lorene Burman (proofreader) to Michael
Alpert with pages
Letters written by Lorene Burman to Michael Alpert

scopecontent.p:
Bound volume with
39 woodcuts pasted in
Miniature mock-up of bound volume in case
